title: Can the rocket reach MARS on time ?

data.title: Can the rocket reach MARS on time ?
data.statement:
A rocket with astronauts on board is on a mission to MARS to attend a conference with the alien chiefs on a confidential matter. The distance between the rocket to the Mars is [[dist]]. But, the aliens are so strict about the timings and set a time limit [[t]], within which you must reach Mars. You will be given the initial speed [[s]] (in km/hr), for which it will continue to move for the first hour. But the rocket briefly fires its engines to change its speed every hour. The same variation [[v]] in speed occurs once every hour throughout the mission. At the end of the time limit, your program must output whether the rocket is able to reach Mars or not...

<< Remember: >> The rocket changes it's speed only once every hour. And the value for [[v]] can be either negative or positive. The output must be <<true>> if the rocket reaches Mars exactly at [[t]] hours or before, if it fails, then <<false>>. You must also output the distance it would actually cover at the end of [[t]] hours.
data.stubGenerator:
read dist:int t:int s:int v:int
write true/false
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[dist]] The distance between the rocket and Mars
<<Line 2:>> [[t]] Time limit for the mission in hours
<<Line 3:>> [[s]] Initial speed of the rocket that is uniform throughout the first hour
<<Line 4:>> [[v]] Variation in speed every hour
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> true if it is possible for the rocket to reach Mars on time, otherwise false. Along with the distance the rocket would cover at the end of [[t]] hours.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A rocket with astronauts on board is on a mission to MARS to attend a conference with the alien chiefs on a confidential matter. The distance between the rocket to the Mars is dist. But, the aliens are so strict about the timings and set a time limit t, within which you must reach Mars. You will be given the initial speed s (in km/hr), for which it will continue to move for the first hour. But the rocket briefly fires its engines to change its speed every hour. The same variation v in speed occurs once every hour throughout the mission. At the end of the time limit, your program must output whether the rocket is able to reach Mars or not...

Remember: The rocket changes it's speed only once every hour. And the value for v can be either negative or positive. The output must be true if the rocket reaches Mars exactly at t hours or before, if it fails, then false. You must also output the distance it would actually cover at the end of t hours.
Input
Line 1: dist The distance between the rocket and Mars
Line 2: t Time limit for the mission in hours
Line 3: s Initial speed of the rocket that is uniform throughout the first hour
Line 4: v Variation in speed every hour
Output
Line 1: true if it is possible for the rocket to reach Mars on time, otherwise false. Along with the distance the rocket would cover at the end of t hours.
Constraints
50 < dist < 10000
1 < t < 200
0 < s < 9000
-1000 < v < 10000
Example
Input
100 2 40 30
Output
true 110
